sen.j: 久松 勝行（ひさまつ かつゆき）は、下総国多胡藩の第7代藩主。
sen.e: Katsuyuki HISAMATSU was the seventh lord of Tako Domain in Shimosa Province.
Katsuyuki HISAMATSU was the seventh lord of Tako Domain in Shimosa Province.
Katsuyuki HISAMATSU was the seventh lord of Tako Domain in Shimosa Province.

sen.j: 天保3年（1832年）3月26日、第6代藩主・松平勝権の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: Born as the first son of the sixth lord, Katsunori MATSUDAIRA on March 26, 1832.
Born as the first son of the sixth lord, Katsunori MATSUDAIRA on March 26, 1832.
Born as the first son of the sixth lord, Katsunori MATSUDAIRA on March 26, 1832.

sen.j: 嘉永元年（1848年）10月7日、父の隠居で家督を継いで第7代藩主となり、12月16日に従五位下・豊後守に叙位・任官する。
sen.e: After his father's retirement, he succeeded to the property to become the seventh lord on October 7, 1848, and was conferred and appointed for Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Bungo no kami (governor of Bungo Province) on December 16.

After his father's retirement, he succeeded to the property to become the seventh lord on October 7, 1848, and was conferred and appointed for Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Bungo no kami (governor of Bungo Province) on December 16.

After his father's retirement, he succeeded to the property to become the seventh lord on October 7, 1848, and was conferred and appointed for Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Bungo no kami (governor of Bungo Province) on December 16.

sen.j: ところが嘉永2年（1849年）7月、江戸幕府より預かっていた罪人の神代徳次郎に脱走されるという醜態を犯した。
sen.e: However, he gave a poor account of himself that a criminal 神代徳次郎, for whom Katsuyuki had responsibility by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), escaped in July 1849.
sen.cmt: 神代徳次郎の読みがわかりませんでした。
sen.e: However, he gave a poor account of himself that a criminal Tokujiro Kumashiro, for whom Katsuyuki had responsibility given by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), escaped in July 1849.
sen.cmt: リサーチしましたが、「神代徳次郎」の正式な読みはわかりませんでした。「神代」は「くましろ」「徳次郎」は「とくじろう」と読むことから、左記の読み方をあてました。responsibility by the→responsibility given byに変更しました。
sen.e: However, he gave a poor account of himself that a criminal Tokujiro Kumashiro, for whom Katsuyuki had responsibility given by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), escaped in July 1849.

sen.j: 神代は8月に京都で捕縛されたが、この失態により江戸町奉行・遠山景元によって12月19日に閉門処分に処され、家臣団も処罰の対象となった。
sen.e: 神代 was captured in Kyoto in August, but Katsuyuki was subjected to house confinement on December 19 by Kagemoto TOYAMA, a Edo machi-bugyo (the magistrate of Edo city), for the blunder, and his vassals were also incurred penalty.

Kumashiro was captured in Kyoto in August, but Katsuyuki was sentenced to house confinement as a punishment on December 19 by Kagemoto TOYAMA, a Edo machi-bugyo (the magistrate of Edo city), for the blunder, and his vassals were also punished.
sen.cmt: were also incurred penalty→were also punishedに変更しました。
sen.e: Kumashiro was captured in Kyoto in August, but Katsuyuki was sentenced to house confinement as a punishment on December 19 by Kagemoto TOYAMA, a Edo machi-bugyo (the magistrate of Edo city), for the blunder, and his vassals were also punished.

sen.j: さらに領地替の名目で領地を替えられて、実高において2000石の減封となった。
sen.e: Furthermore, his territory was changed under the pretext of Ryochigae (change of territory), being reduced the territory 2000 koku (360.78 cubic meters).
sen.cmt: 領地替の定訳が不明ですが、change of territoryといたしました。
sen.e: Furthermore, his territory was changed under the pretext of Ryochigae (change of territory), being reduced the territory 2,000 koku (360.78 cubic meters).
Furthermore, his territory was changed under the pretext of Ryochigae (change of territory), being reduced the territory 2,000 koku (360.78 cubic meters).

sen.j: 嘉永3年（1850年）5月22日に閉門処分を解かれている。
sen.e: On May 22, 1850, he was released from the house confinement.
On May 22, 1850, he was released from the house confinement.
On May 22, 1850, he was released from the house confinement.

sen.j: 安政2年（1855年）2月2日に大坂加番に任じられ、文久2年（1862年）閏8月19日に二条城定番に任じられる。
sen.e: He was appointed to Osaka-kaban (a person to guard Osaka-jo Castle) and Nijo-jo Castle Teiban (gatekeeper) in February 2, 1855 and August 19 1862, respectively.
He was appointed to Osaka-kaban (a person to guard Osaka-jo Castle) and Nijo-jo Castle Teiban (gatekeeper) in February 2, 1855 and August 19 1862, respectively.
He was appointed to Osaka-kaban (a person to guard Osaka-jo Castle) and Nijo-jo Castle Teiban (gatekeeper) in February 2, 1855 and August 19 1862, respectively.

sen.j: 幕末期は九十九里直忠組の反乱鎮圧で功を挙げ、元治元年（1864年）7月21日に大蔵少輔に遷任する。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, he transferred to Kyoto as Okura no shofu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Treasury) on July 21, 1864 in recognition of the suppressing the rebellion of 九十九里直忠組.
sen.cmt: 九十九里直忠組の読み・定訳が分かりませんでした。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, he transferred to Okura no shofu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Treasury) on July 21, 1864 in recognition of the suppressing the rebellion of 九十九里直忠組.
sen.cmt: to Kyotoはオリジナルに記述がないため省略しました。「九十九里（くじゅうくり）」「九十九（つくも）」などいろいろな読み方がありますが、「九十九里直忠組」の正式名称は見つかりませんでした。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, he transferred to Okura no shofu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Treasury) on July 21, 1864 in recognition of the suppressing the rebellion of 九十九里直忠組.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）4月に日光祭礼奉行に任じられた。
sen.e: In April 1867, he was appointed to Nikko Sairei Bugyo (festival magistrate).
In April 1867, he was appointed to Nikko Sairei Bugyo (festival magistrate).
In April 1867, he was appointed to Nikko Sairei Bugyo (festival magistrate).

sen.j: 戊辰戦争時の慶応4年（1868年）2月、徳川氏との訣別を示すために姓を松平から久松に改めた。
sen.e: During the Boshin war, he changed his surname from Matsudaira to Hisamatsu for putting an end to the relationship with the Tokugawa clan in February 1868.
During the Boshin war, he changed his surname from Matsudaira to Hisamatsu for putting an end to the relationship with the Tokugawa clan in February 1868.
During the Boshin war, he changed his surname from Matsudaira to Hisamatsu for putting an end to the relationship with the Tokugawa clan in February 1868.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）6月の版籍奉還で多胡藩知事に任じられた。
sen.e: As a result of the Hansekihokan (the return of the domain registers to the Meiji Emperor), he was appointed to the governor of the Tako Domain in June 1869.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As a result of the Hansekihokan (the return of the domain registers to the Meiji Emperor), he was appointed to the governor of the Tako Domain in June 1869.
As a result of the Hansekihokan (the return of the domain registers to the Meiji Emperor), he was appointed to the governor of the Tako Domain in June 1869.

sen.j: しかし、直後の8月に死去した。
sen.e: Immediately after that, however, he died in August.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Immediately after that, however, he died in August.
Immediately after that, however, he died in August.
He was 38 years old.
He was 38 years old.
He was 38 years old.

sen.j: 後を長男の久松勝慈が継いだ。
sen.e: His eldest son, Katsunari HISAMATSU succeeded Katsuyuki.
His eldest son, Katsunari HISAMATSU succeeded Katsuyuki.
His eldest son, Katsunari HISAMATSU succeeded Katsuyuki.
